lang::Object Class Reference
[Language support library]

#include <Object.h>

Inheritance diagram for lang::Object:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Object class has functionality for reference counting.

If an Object is created in stack then special care must be taken that the object reference count is not affected anywhere as it will result in crash when the object goes out of scope in the stack. Note that Object reference count modifying is not thread safe operation.


Public Member Functions

void addReference ()
 Increments reference count by one.
 Object (const Object &)
 Initializes reference count to zero.

 Initializes reference count to zero.

 Does nothing.
int references () const
 Returns number of references left.
void release ()
 Decrements reference count and uses operator delete to the object when the count reaches zero.
virtual ~Object ()
 Ensures that the reference count is zero.
